_symbol_format: .TICKER YYMMDD P/C STRIKE  (positive qty = buy, negative = sell)
_source: Ravish passive strategies playbook - Short Put LEAPS
notes: NVDA short put LEAPS: sell 190P Jan 2027, ~$30 credit, 16% downside protection to 160. 6-12 month duration, set-and-forget.
rationale: Long-term income strategy. 80% of capital allocation. Sell puts on quality stocks above long-term support. Min 20% ROI. High win rate, minimal management. Like real estate investing — look for good deals.

entry_conditions.iv_environment: Elevated IV preferred — more credit collected. IV rank >30 ideal.

delta_target.note: 30-50 delta. Higher delta = more credit but more risk. For margin: use 20-25 delta for more downside.

stock_criteria.note: Stock must be above long-term support zone. RSI under 30 (oversold). Look for stocks that have taken a beating but fundamentals are intact.

fundamental_check.note: Look for stocks like CRWV — beaten down, above support, P/E lower than industry

entry_conditions.min_roi: 20% annualized. If using margin (2x max leverage), target 40%+ ROI on margin.
entry_conditions.position_sizing: Cash-secured: need full strike amount ($19,000 for 190 strike). Margin: ~$3,700 (but need more downside cushion — reduce strike to 160).

leverage_rules.without_leverage: Very low risk. Cash-secured put. Full collateral.
leverage_rules.with_leverage: Max 2x leverage. Reduce strike to 25 delta (160) for more downside protection. Breakeven drops to ~25% below current.
leverage_rules.margin_warning: If using margin, ensure downside breakeven is at least 20% below current price

entry_timing.frequency: Opportunistic — when quality stock is near support + oversold
entry_timing.note: Not a weekly trade. Wait for the right setup. Like buying real estate — patience.

entry_conditions.notes: Short Put LEAPS: 6-12 month duration. Sell put on individual top stocks (not indices). Ensure stock is above long-term support, RSI under 30. Min 20% ROI. Put credit in treasury bill while waiting. Take profit at 20-40%. If stock drops 25%+ below strike after expiry, consider buying shares (wheel into covered call).

pnl_drivers.max_profit: Credit received ($3,000 for 190 strike, ~20% ROI cash-secured, ~81% ROI on margin)
pnl_drivers.max_loss: Strike price x 100 - credit received (if stock goes to zero). Realistic: stock at breakeven ~$160.
pnl_drivers.primary_driver: Theta decay — time value erodes over 6-12 months. Accelerates in final 2-3 months.
pnl_drivers.secondary_driver: Stock staying above strike or rising. IV crush after entry (if entered during elevated IV).
pnl_drivers.tertiary_driver: Put credit invested in treasury bills generates additional yield while waiting.

greeks_profile.theta: positive — collecting daily time decay over 6-12 months
greeks_profile.vega: negative — short vega, profits from IV decrease (but LEAPS vega is large, so IV spike hurts)
greeks_profile.delta: positive — short put has positive delta, profits from stock rising
greeks_profile.gamma: slightly negative — manageable with LEAPS duration (gamma is low for long-dated options)

exit_rules.profit_target: 20-40% of max profit. Book early if target hit.
exit_rules.stop_loss: If stock breaks below long-term support zone, reassess. If fundamentals intact, hold.
exit_rules.at_expiry: If assigned, accept shares and transition to LEAPS covered call (wheel strategy).
exit_rules.early_profit: If in significant profit much earlier than expiry, book it and move to next trade.

risk_scenarios.market_crash: Reduce strike to 100 (small delta, but ensure at least 20 delta for credit). Breakeven 25%+ below current.
risk_scenarios.with_margin: Use 25 delta, get half credit but half margin. Downside breakeven ~25% below current.

pnl_drivers.ideal_scenario: NVDA stays above 190 over 11 months. Collect $3,000 credit. Theta decays to zero. Book at 20-40% profit early, or let expire worthless. Redeploy capital.
